absyn

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • absyn.Absyn
      • absyn.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Assignment, CommandSeq, For, IfThenElse, LocalDeclaration, LocalScope, MethodCallCommand, Return, Skip, While

    public abstract class Command
extends Absyn
    A node of abstract syntax representing a Kitten command. Commands are syntactical structures that yield no value.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeChecker

        public TypeChecker getTypeChecker()
        Yields the type-checker resulting from the last type-checking of this command.
        Returns:
        The type-checker resulting from the last type-checking of this command. Yields null if this command has not been type-checked yet

      • toDot

        public final java.lang.String toDot(java.io.FileWriter where)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes in the specified file a dot representation of the abstract syntax of this command. By default, it writes a single dot node for this node of abstract syntax and it calls the auxiliary #toDotAux(FileWriter) method. Subclasses should redefine the latter in order to consider components of commands. It then calls itself recursively on the subsequent command, if any.
        Parameters:
        where - the file where the dot representation must be written
        Returns:
        the name used to refer to this node in the dot file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while writing the file

      • typeCheck

        public final TypeChecker typeCheck(TypeChecker checker)
        Performs the type-checking of this command by using a given type-checker. It calls the command-specific type-checking method typeCheckAux(TypeChecker) and then type-checks the subsequent commands, if any.
        Parameters:
        checker - the type-checker to be used for type-checking
        Returns:
        a type-checker derived from checker by type-checking this and the subsequent commands

      • checkForDeadcode

        public abstract boolean checkForDeadcode()
        Checks that this command does not contain dead-code, that is, commands which can never be executed. This method considers a syntactical definition of dead-code. It is actually undecidable to determine if a piece of code will never be executed at run-time. The only guarantee provided by this method is that if some dead-code is found, then it really is dead-code. The converse might not hold (semantically correct but incomplete behavior).
        Returns:
        true if and only if every syntactical execution path in this command ends with a return command

      • translate

        public abstract Block translate(CodeSignature where,
                                Block continuation)
        Translates this command into its intermediate Kitten code. The result is a code that executes the command by leaving the stack unchanged, exactly as it were before the execution of the command.
        Parameters:
        where - the method or constructor where the command occurs
        continuation - the continuation to be executed after this command
        Returns:
        the code executing this command
